ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned basic Korean and a surprising amount of culture! It was so fun!

I have learned basic conversations. I can tell people where I want to go or what I want to do. I can also tell people directions and ask them to do or not do things. I have also learned some Korean cultures.

Basic korean greetings, sentence structure, conversation topics and answers, grammar etc.

insights: into korean culture (food, kpop, festivals etc)

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I wish there were fewer group projects. They're fun to do, but very difficult to work around everyone's schedules. Other than that, class was phenomenal.
Strength: pretty rigorous training through constant homework and daily classes

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I definitely would, if you are interested in learning Korean, though it is a fair amount of work so you need to have time to dedicate to it.
Yes! Learn new languages and Korean is a very good choice considering current affairs!
Yes, I would. If you are interested in Korean culture, you should definitely take this course. When I watch K-drama, I start picking up some phrases I learned in class.
Yes if they are interested in learning the language
